abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability highly likely, and
            institutional development impacts are high. Lessons that
            contributed positively to the success of this technical
            assistance (TA) operation, highlight the importance for
            basic legislation regarding sector reform, to be in place
            prior to project effectiveness, to strengthen institutions,
            and in turn, allow the project to become an essential tool
            for the sector development objectives. Moreover, the TA
            adapted itself to supporting expenses, which would not have
            been available through conventional financing, and was
            responsive in providing resources, e.g., training
            assistance. Nonetheless, regarding the project's
            shortcomings, lessons convey: 1) the need to possibly extend
            TA to other institutions, not originally contemplated as
            beneficiaries, as in this case, a sector-wide perspective
            would have identified the Public Services Super-intendence
            as a potential beneficiary; 2) the array of contracts
            awarded under TA was indicative of a certain degree of
            dispersal, and not a contributor factor; instead, a stronger
            supervision could have addressed this issue; and, 3) studies
            contracted under TA projects should be closely followed, to
            ensure responsiveness to the agency's actual needs.
